channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google’s Ruth Porat: To unlock AI’s upside, rethink every process
item.description: "I think we are living in an extraordinary time," Porat said at the Fortune Global Forum.

item.title: 6 Best Practices for Managing a Fast-Growing Business’s Finances
item.description: What worked when you were a 20-person startup often collapses under the weight of hundreds of employees and fast-changing customer demands.

item.title: ‘The world is changing’: Amazon announces 14,000 layoffs ahead of the holidays, cites AI innovation
item.description: The world’s largest retailer has announced massive job cuts before the holidays. On Tuesday, Amazon said in a memo to staff that it will lay off 14,00...

item.title: ‘Are you crazy?’ ‘A little…’ Inside one obsessed U.S. Agent’s $50 million secret plot to capture Nicolás Maduro by turning his pilot against him
item.description: Armed with a $50 million bounty and a rogue plan, a Homeland Security agent tried to flip Maduro’s personal pilot into delivering Venezuela’s presiden...

item.title: Food banks are bracing for a surge of hungry people as potential USDA pause of SNAP benefits looms
item.description: Food banks and pantries were already struggling after federal program cuts this year, but now they’re bracing for a tsunami of hungry people if a paus...

item.title: 7 Powerful Phrases That Turn Good Teams Into Great Ones
item.description: Building a high-performing team requires more than just delegating work.

item.title: The Fed is expected to cut key interest rate to boost weak U.S. job market
item.description: The Federal Reserve will almost certainly cut its key interest rate on Wednesday and could signal it expects another cut in December as the central ba...

item.title: Inside Ford’s vision to turn your EV into a personal power plant
item.description: As more and more drivers purchase electric vehicles , some people have voiced concerns about how the EV boom could further strain our aging, stressed ...

item.title: Ray Dalio is guided by gratitude: Why CEOs need to find their codifying principles
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: 3 Tips for How Vibe Coding Can Save Your Company Money
item.description: Vibe-coding experts at the Inc. 5000 Conference & Gala had some pretty straightforward advice for how to get started.

item.title: Want to Turn Customers Into Brand Loyalists? Give Them This Reward
item.description: These two companies have helped restaurants grow more robust businesses by fostering loyalty among customers.

item.title: Chegg’s CEO once said he’s the ‘poster child’ for AI shock. Now, the company is slashing 45% of staff
item.description: The edtech pioneer cuts 388 jobs and brings back Dan Rosensweig as CEO, underscoring how generative AI and shrinking Google traffic are reshaping stud...

item.title: As U.S. flight disruptions and shutdown drag on, air traffic controllers brace for missing paychecks
item.description: A shortage of air traffic controllers caused more flight disruptions Monday around the country as controllers braced for their first full missing payc...

item.title: 5 Tips for Building a Brand Like Nike
item.description: Former Nike marketers Sanja Komljenovic and Ramonita Smith spoke about the importance of storytelling at the Inc. 5000 conference.

item.title: Bill Gates says a ‘doomsday outlook’ on climate is driving people to focus on the wrong things
item.description: "If given a choice between eradicating malaria and a tenth of a degree increase in warming, I'll let the temperature go up," Gates said.
